task.title: Undo/Redo
task.shortdesc: Reverses one or more of the previous commands; can also be used to re-perform a move.

context.p: Users have the power to undo or redo moves using the Command History

step.cmd: Click the History Tab to view the Command History.
step.stepresult: The History displays all of the user's previous actions.

step.cmd: Click the left arrow to go back one step.
Click the right arrow to go forward one step.
step.info: Once you have reversed past a step, it turns from yellow to blue. You can delete the blue steps by clicking the black "x." This allows you to remove steps from the sequence and edit out undesirable moves.

step.cmd: Click the double arrows to jump to the beginning or end of the sequence.
step.info: After undoing a step, executing a new command will reset the sequence from that point.
